Subsection.title: Overview
Subsection.Paragraph: The idstore server package is available from several sources:

Regardless of the distribution method, the idstore package will contain a command named idstore that acts as the main entrypoint to all of the server's functionality. The idstore command expect environment variables named IDSTORE_SERVER_HOME and IDSTORE_SERVER_LOG_DIRECTORY to be defined that point to the installation directory and log directory, respectively. See the documentation for the installation methods below for details.

Subsection.title: PostgreSQL
Subsection.Paragraph: The idstore server requires a PostgreSQL server. The idstore server will create the required tables and database objects on first startup, given the name of a running PostgreSQL database, and a PostgreSQL role and password.

Subsection.title: Podman/Docker
Subsection.Paragraph: The idstore package can be installed from Docker Hub using docker or podman.

FormalItem.title: Docker/Podman Pull
FormalItem.Verbatim:
$ docker pull docker.io/io7m/idstore:${project.version}
$ podman pull docker.io/io7m/idstore:${project.version}

Subsection.Paragraph: The image is configured such that IDSTORE_SERVER_HOME=/idstore, with the idstore command existing at /idstore/bin/idstore, and IDSTORE_SERVER_LOG_DIRECTORY=/idstore/log. The image is configured with the expectation that users will mount a volume at /idstore/etc containing a configuration file, and a volume at /idstore/log that will contain log files. The container can otherwise be run without any privileges, and with a read-only root filesystem.

FormalItem.title: Run
FormalItem.Verbatim: $ podman run \ --read-only \ --volume /x/y/a:/idstore/etc:Z \ --volume /x/y/b:/idstore/log:Z \ -i \ -t \ docker.io/io7m/idstore:${project.version} idstore info: Usage: idstore [options] [command] [command options] ...

Subsection.title: Maven Central
Subsection.Paragraph:
A distribution package can be found at
Maven Central.
The idstore command requires that a Java 17+ compatible JVM be accessible via /usr/bin/env java.
Verify the integrity of the distribution zip file:

FormalItem.title: Verify
FormalItem.Verbatim: $ gpg --verify com.io7m.idstore.server.main-${project.version}-distribution.zip.asc gpg: assuming signed data in 'com.io7m.idstore.server.main-${project.version}-distribution.zip.asc' gpg: Signature made Tue 28 Jun 2022 15:01:56 GMT gpg: using RSA key 3CCE59428B30462D10459909C5607DA146E128B8 gpg: issuer "contact@io7m.com" gpg: using pgp trust model gpg: Good signature from "io7m.com (2022 maven-rsa-key) <contact@io7m.com>" [unknown]

Subsection.Paragraph: Unzip the zip file, and set up the environment appropriately:

FormalItem.title: Extract
FormalItem.Verbatim: $ unzip com.io7m.idstore.server.main-${project.version}-distribution.zip $ export IDSTORE_SERVER_HOME=$(realpath idstore) $ export IDSTORE_SERVER_LOG_DIRECTORY=/var/log/idstore $ ./idstore/bin/idstore info: Usage: idstore [options] [command] [command options] ...
